Case reference: 2019007309.CaseDesc: On December 12, 2018, Robert Campbell was seen for the last time as he left work in Toronto, Ontario. Robert had not been seen for three months before he was reported missing.

Case reference: 2014005260.CaseDesc: On May 31, 2009, at approximately 6:00 p.m., Gordon Farrow was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Gordon advised that he was going to Sudbury, Ontario, but has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2016000962.CaseDesc: On January 5, 2016, Felix Claveau was last seen when he jumped off the Viau Bridge into the Rivière-des-Prairies in Laval, Quebec. Felix hasn’t been seen since.

Case reference: 2013000140.CaseDesc: On June 1, 1981, Rene Laflamme was last seen in Montreal, Quebec. René had visited his mother in Ottawa, Ontario and had left her residence to travel back to Montreal.

Case reference: 2014004643.CaseDesc: On July 28, 2002, Carol Tuks was last seen while exiting a Greyhound bus in Red Deer, Alberta.

Pierce: Ears, single piercing in each ear

Case reference: 2014004162.CaseDesc: On October 16, 1987, Charles Eddy was seen for the last time when he left his residence in Moncton, New Brunswick, where he lived with his brother. Charles suffered from partial schizophrenia, was known to be heavy smoker and carry large sums of money.

Case reference: 2016026481.CaseDesc:
On October 2, 1970, the remains of a Caucasian male were found along Wellington County Road, near Guelph/Cambridge, Ontario. He had severe osteoarthritis in his lumbar area, which may have been painful. Found in close proximity were a yellow carpenter's pencil and a tin spectacle case. 9 various buttons were found: 1 overcoat button, 1 trouser button, 3 shirt buttons, 4 underwear buttons; and some pieces of fabric that may be from a white shirt and white socks were also recovered. 
He is believed to have been deceased for approximately 20 years.

Teeth: His teeth were in excellent condition but did have some marked wear.
Money: Six Canadian and American coins dated 1936-1945
Belt: Leather, Size 32 with a Steer's head buckle
Hat: Grey, FEDORA, Hat band, initials "J.U", "Calhoun's", " Bathersby"

Case reference: 2014046775.CaseDesc: On November 10, 2014, at approximately 2:00 p.m., Sofia Touila was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Sofia had told her friend that she would be going home but did not return.

Case reference: 2014001638.CaseDesc: On November 18, 1977, at approximately 2:00 a.m., Norman Louison was last seen walking to a residence on the Cowessess First Nation near Broadview, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2016064545.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2007, skeletal remains of a man were discovered in a farmer's field near the Athabasca River. It is possible that these remains came from the river. This individual did not have any upper teeth and likely wore dentures. The sacrum was deformed and there is a possibility that he walked with a limp.

Case reference: 2007004899.CaseDesc: James Gordon MacDonald was last seen by his father on October 23, 1980 in Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario. An extensive investigation by the Sault Ste Marie Police Service was conducted but to this date Mr. MacDonald has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2020019009.CaseDesc: On June 8, 2020, Sameer Patel was seen for the last time by his friends when he accidentally fell into the Niagara River located in Ontario, while hiking.

Case reference: 2020018574.CaseDesc: Steven WOYTOWICH is believed to be homeless and was last seen in the Beverly area of Edmonton, Alberta, in early March of 2020.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, lady on a mushroom

Case reference: 2022039393.CaseDesc: On August 6, 2022, Angela Breau was seen for the last time at her residence in Moncton, New Brunswick. She left her residence without her dentures, wallet, or other personal effects.  At the time of her disappearance, Angela was suffering from mental health issues and she has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2020008580.CaseDesc: On December 14, 1973, at approximately 8:30 am, Teresa Desa was seen for the last time at her family home in Toronto, Ontario. There is a possibility that Teresa ran away with the family’s tenant, Amavel Santos.

Coat: Brown, Light brown with white trim

Case reference: 2018046253.CaseDesc: On January 31, 1997, at approximately 4:30pm, Daphne Powell was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario. Daphne left her residence with two suitcases, some money and indicated that she was going to Jamaica.

Case reference: 2015068386.CaseDesc: On April 12, 2015, the remains of a newborn baby boy were found on the grounds of the Free Church of Scotland in Mount Albion, Prince Edward Island.  The body was found wrapped in a towel with a green frog embroidered on it.

Case reference: 2014002218.CaseDesc: On September 18, 1977, Arthur Roy was seen for the last time, at approximately 1400hrs, when he left his home on foot in North Bay, Ontario. Mr. Roy was suffering from a mental illness and was believed to be senile due to old age.

Case reference: 2014004206.CaseDesc: On September 18, 1988, 3 people were visiting Leonard Kalichak at his residence and had decided to go out in a boat on Lake Dauphin, Manitoba. When they left shore they were faced with adverse conditions subsequently capsizing the boat. At this point, Mr. Kalichak immediately went under the water, possibly as a result of heavy clothing or an injury sustained when the boat capsized. Searches were conducted by land, air, water and dragging operations on the lake. Leonard Kalichak has never been found and he is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2019020557.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2019, at 9:00 pm, Rebecca Dorman was last seen leaving a friend's residence located at the intersection of Mohawk Road East and Upper Wellington Street in Hamilton, Ontario. Rebecca had been staying with her friend, and left the residence without her shoes, purse, phone or keys.

Case reference: 2014006339.CaseDesc: Karen Kozicki was reported missing on May 13, 1996, after she failed to return home from place of employment in Edmonton, Alberta. Karen's vehicle was located on June 23, 1996, near Hanmore Lake, near the town of Smokey Lake, Alberta.

Case reference: 2021037665.CaseDesc: On August 24, 2021 Donald Preston was reported missing in Quesnel, British Columbia and was last seen on July 31, 2021 in Kersley, British Columbia. It is possible that Donald may have travelled east to New Brunswick.

Case reference: 2014004138.CaseDesc: On November 15, 2002, Sefacag Erdinc was last seen at his residence in Mission, British Columbia. Since then, Mr. Erdinc has not been seen or heard from.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Moon and Star

Case reference: 2006013899.CaseDesc: Robert Heintz went missing from Kearns, Ontario on the morning of December 1, 1982.  Mr. Heintz went into the bush behind Larder Lake Public School with some friends and became separated from them.  He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005385.CaseDesc: The Calgary Police Service is seeking the public's assistance in locating Laura Lee Murray. She was last seen in downtown Calgary, Alberta, on June 25, 1992.

Case reference: 2014004819.CaseDesc: Reginald Andrew FLETT (known as Reggie) was last seen walking around downtown Thompson, Manitoba shortly before his disappearance on either September 16th or 17th, 2007. FLETT had also been spotted earlier near both the Thompson Walmart and the Extra Foods. He was reported as missing by a family member on September 19, 2006.   Shortly thereafter, family members from Split Lake, Manitoba conducted searches around both Split Lake and Thompson, both of which failed to uncover any trace of FLETT. Thereafter, missing persons posters were distributed throughout Thompson. Although FLETT's whereabouts remain unknown, the investigation is ongoing.

Case reference: 2006013699.CaseDesc: Emile Morissette was last seen while on a fishing trip at Birch Lake in Timmins Township, Ontario on July 6, 1976.

Case reference: 2005005399.CaseDesc: On April 15, 1993, the body of an unidentified man was found on the shore of Lake Ontario, near the intersection of Maplegrove Road and Lakeshore Road in Lincoln.  His post-mortem weight was recorded as being  174lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: Amalgam fillings in his lower molars

Case reference: 2015052895.CaseDesc: Ujjvalkumar Patel was last seen on June 15, 2015 at his workplace in Brampton, ON. Ujjvalkumar was attending college in Ontario. He told his landlord he was returning to India for a family emergency but never showed up.

Case reference: 2014003366.CaseDesc: The morning of July 8, 1981,  the Happy Valley-Goose Bay RCMP were notified that an aluminum boat with an outboard motor was going in circles just out from the new houses in Sheshatshiu, NL.  Police were advised that the boat was unoccupied and travelling quite fast in circles. The investigation determined that the boat had been once occupied by John Morris Groves of North West River, NL and it appears that he had fallen overboard.  The body of Mr. Groves has not yet been located.

Case reference: 2014001521.CaseDesc: On November 3, 1972, a helicopter carrying a pilot and three passengers went missing in Lake Winnipeg. The helicopter left Thompson, Manitoba at 3:20 p.m. and was heading for Winnipeg after stopping at a number of communities. The helicopter landed at Warren's Landing at approximately 5:20 p.m., and left for Winnipeg. The pilot reported that the weather was poor and he estimated his arrival in Winnipeg at 8:00 p.m. At 5:50 p.m. there was radio contact with the pilot where he stated that he was over Poplar River. This was the last radio contact with this helicopter. The Canadian Air Search and Rescue, private aircraft and police aircraft searched until November 17, 1972 when the search was suspended until the spring of 1973. Nathan Kryger and Ian Fraser are presumed dead as a result of the helicopter crash. Foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2013000126.CaseDesc: In December 2007, Bonnie Marie Joseph was reported missing to the Fort St-James RCMP.  Further investigation determined that Miss Joseph was last seen on September 8, 2007 in Vanderhoof, BC.  She led a high risk lifestyle and was known to hitchhike alone between Fort St-James, Vanderhoof and Prince George, BC.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, heart with Mom & Djily

Case reference: 2014002404.CaseDesc: On June 11, 1988, Andrew Flett was walking with others to the cutline. Mr. Flett  did not show up at the site and crew members thought he had returned to camp. Mr. Flett  was reported missing three days later to RCMP, and an extensive search was conducted. Mr. Flett  has not been located and his whereabouts are unknown.

Shirt: Red, Black, plaid and button up

Case reference: 2018063453.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2003, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Senotta Thomas was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario. Senotta had left her home to go to work, but did not return home.

Case reference: 2008009698.CaseDesc: Richard Rusholme was last seen when he left his residence.  He was preparing to leave with a friend to look for work out West and had already packed his bags. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001023.CaseDesc: On August 3, 1998, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Fraser River in Delta, British Columbia. The man’s body was found in the south end of the Fraser Surrey Docks Ltd and it is estimated that he may have possibly died between October 1997 and April 1998.

Jewelry: Wood, Brown, Black, Necklace, 1.5" Cross on cord
Shirt: Cloth, Black, Blue, T Shirt, Brand Bugle Boy
Jacket: Cloth, Tan, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Winter, Down filled, purple inside
Pants: Denim, Blue, IKEDA, Brand Marks & Spencer
Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running, Brand Reebok, size 9

Case reference: 2014005024.CaseDesc: On November 16, 2007, Pierre Landry was seen for the last time in the area of Saint-Joseph-de-Beauce, Quebec. Pierre would have left his residence on foot and there are no indications in the direction he would have taken.

Case reference: 2014006178.CaseDesc: An investigation revealed that nobody had seen or heard from Alex Klym since the mid 1970's. The family had made attempts to locate Alex, but they were unsuccessful and nobody ever reported that he was missing. Inquiries were made with various government agencies in an attempt to find some evidence of him after the mid 1970's. There is no trace of him. The body of Alex Klym has never been recovered. It is not known what happened to Alex, but foul play cannot be ruled out.

Case reference: 2014001314.CaseDesc: On May 2, 1981, Verna Bjerky was seen for the last time hitchhiking from Hope to Kamloops, British Columbia. She was carrying roller skates over her shoulder and was seen getting into a vehicle with a lone occupant. Verna has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Long blonde hair with short bangs
Shoes: Canvas, Brown, "North Star" Brand, running shoes
Shirt: Red, White, Red with white flowers

Case reference: 2022015231.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2022, Kyle Brocklebank was seen for the last time walking in the area of Thirty Road, in the town of Smithville, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004820.CaseDesc: On September 21, 2006, William Teya was seen for the last time in Fort McPherson, Northwest Territories.

Jacket: Black, Dark; E. Gruben Transport on left chest

Case reference: 2014004868.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2004, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Stephen Liou was seen for the last time as he left his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020137.CaseDesc: On Friday September 27, 1963, Diane Carrier went to the neighborhood park in the Old Quebec district of Quebec City, Quebec, to advise her brother to return home for dinner. Her brother came home alone and Diane has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2014002754.CaseDesc: On November 3rd, 1963, Charles Williams was seen operating a 12' outboard motorboat in coastal waters and did not return home.

Case reference: 2020011626.CaseDesc: On September 18, 1989, Ioan Sandea was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006008199.CaseDesc: Harley Metherel telephoned home from Vancouver on December 24, 1980, requesting a money transfer. Money was sent to him, but he never picked it up, and he has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2013000021.CaseDesc: Bones of a right foot with its sock and shoe were found along a river bank.

Case reference: 2014005846.CaseDesc: André Boucher was last seen on July 16, 2012 in Montreal. Mr. Boucher was living in a rooming house and left all his belongings behind. Mr. Boucher was also known as "Popeye"

Case reference: 2014004817.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2006, Timothy Lang departed his residence in Chilliwack, British Columbia in his vehicle, a grey Chevrolet Metro. Timothy left behind all his personal belongings, wallet, and passport. On September 11, 2006, his vehicle was located in the parking lot of the Othello Tunnels in the Coquihalla Canyon Provincial Park, located in Hope, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2020008533.CaseDesc: On January 15, 1982, at approximately 7:30 am, Jona Rashid was last seen near 2275 Weston Road in Toronto, Ontario. Jona had called his sister in law at 5:30pm and stated that he would be coming over for dinner.

Case reference: 2016066066.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2016, at approximately 5:00 p.m., Kevin Dilk was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Kevin has not been seen or heard from since this time.

Case reference: 2020001488.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1988, Edward Parsons was seen for the last time as he was dragged from his apartment by a street gang in Toronto, Ontario. Edward was taken to a beach where he was violently assaulted, and buried in a shallow grave. The police were informed of this incident, and attended the grave. Upon their arrival, the alleged burial site was found empty.

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede
Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 2021009119.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2021, Amber Ellis was reported missing by her mother. Amber communicated with her friends and family, including her two children, on a regular basis prior to her disappearance. During the time of her disappearance, Amber was leading a high-risk lifestyle.

Scar: Left Thigh, Scar from a stab wound

Case reference: 2006007699.CaseDesc: Kelvin Norris left his residence on November 27, 1984 at about 11:00 pm, he has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014006111.CaseDesc: On May 18, 2013, Holly Balzer was reported missing from Calgary, Alberta. Two months prior to her disappearance, Holly last spoke to members of her family.

Deformity: Mouth, has no teeth - sometimes wears dentures
Foreign Object: Left Ankle, pins from a leg break

Case reference: 2014001313.CaseDesc: On August 26, 1976, at 11:00 pm, Frederick Seymour was seen for the last time as he stood outside of his residence in Ottawa, Ontario. Mr. Seymour had been seen by his neighbour.

Case reference: 2014005298.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2009, Hatice Corbacioglu was last seen leaving her residence in Toronto, Ontario.  Hatice was bound for New York State, in the USA.

Case reference: 2014030665.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1978, the partial remains of a female believed to be aged between 55-70 years of age, were found in the waters of the Salish Sea, southwest of Victoria, British Columbia. She had moderate arthritis and significant healed injuries to her left ankle and foot. It is believed she was deceased several months or even years before her remains were recovered

Case reference: 2018004583.CaseDesc: On December 6, 1953, Marion McDowell was seen for the last time in a parked car in lover’s lane in Scarborough, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, an unknown man opened the car door, and assaulted Marion’s date rendering him unconscious. When he regained consciousness, she was gone.

Chain: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, With a heart

Case reference: 2013000114.CaseDesc: Abigail Andrews, a single Metis woman, lived in a basement suite in Fort St. John. She worked at FSJ Fashions, and The Frontier Bar and Grill. She was pregnant but not yet showing. Abigail was last seen on the evening of April 7, 2010 walking from her home towards a friend's house.

Teeth: Good, Used a dental pallet retainer
Deformity: Right Index Finger, Previously broken and healed in a deformed position

Case reference: 2014006340.CaseDesc: On January 16, 2002 Anatoli Dibrov went out in the evening for about 1/2 hour. When he came home he appeared secretive. Mr. Dibrov went to bed that evening and that was the last time he was seen. Originally from Russia, it's possible he may have returned.

Boots: Brown, Red, Reddish/brown with red fur trim (only available in Russia)
Gloves: Brown, Grey, Brown mittens or grey gloves

Case reference: 2020010776.CaseDesc: On July 25, 1968, Samuel Hall was seen for the last time when he went out onto Lake Ontario for a fishing trip. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Shirt: Blue, Grey, Work, Emblem with the letters "BA"

Case reference: 2014005517.CaseDesc:
At the time of her disappearance, Amber Guiboche was living in the north end of Winnipeg with her boyfriend and his family. Amber had been leading a high-risk lifestyle.

Amber spent the evening of November 10th, 2010 socializing with friends, later that evening she went to a friend’s residence on Bushnell St. She left there alone at around 11:45 p.m., and walked to the intersection of Isabel Street and William Ave.  

She was picked up there shortly after by a man driving a burgundy pickup truck. The truck was described as an older, burgundy Chevrolet Silverado, extended cab, short box with a “4x4” decal toward the rear of the box. 

The truck was last seen traveling southbound on Isabel St. It was captured on video in the area in which she was last seen.

Images of this truck and a forensic artist’s sketch of the driver have been made available.

Case reference: 2014004667.CaseDesc: The Gypsumville RCMP detachment received a report that an aircraft was in distress over Lake Winnipeg near Reindeer Island. The aircraft, a single engine Cherokee 140, had three people on board; the pilot and two passengers. The pilot had indicated that the engine had seized and that he was trying to make it to Reindeer Island. He then stated that he was going down in to the water. Two RCMP Twin Otters and an Air Search and Rescue Hercules conducted a search by air. It was not possible to search the lake by boat as there was too much ice on the lake. All three are presumed dead due to drowning or from the impact of the crash.

Case reference: 2014003015.CaseDesc: On September 8, 1984 Donald Williamson's brother reported him as missing since September 6th. He has a history of disappearing without maintaining contact with his family. There is no foul play suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2022041871.CaseDesc: On June 20, 1994, Johnny Baker was seen for the last time at his residence in Borger Texas, USA.

Scar: Left Eye, Over the left eye

Case reference: 2014005617.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1995, Bradley Wiesner was on an island in Manitou Lake, Saskatchewan, in the company of other individuals. He was seen for the last time at approximately 8:00 pm when he was swimming towards the boat they were using as it had started to float away from shore.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Necklace with a silver ring on it
Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Wylie Coyote holding a beer mug

Case reference: 2012020651.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1984, Patricia Favel was seen for the last time in the downtown area of Regina, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2013000113.CaseDesc: Lana Derrick was given a ride from Houston, BC where she was going to college, to Terrace where she was dropped off at a friend's house.  Ms. Derrick spent the evening with friends hanging out in the Terrace downtown core.  In the early morning hours of October 7, 1995, Ms. Derrick picked up $30 from a friend's house and was last seen at the Copperside Foods/Petro Canada in Thornhill.  Her family reported her missing three days later when she did not show up for Thanksgiving dinner.

Case reference: 2014005543.CaseDesc: In December 2010, Yellowknife RCMP received a call from a concerned family member reporting that they have not seen or heard from Kelvin Smallgeese since September 2010. At the time of his disappearance, Kelvin was believed to be residing in Yellowknife, Northwest Territories.

Teeth: Dental records indicate 6 teeth missing, 11 treated (occlusal) 15 unknown
Tattoo: Left Hand, A rose and a heart

Case reference: 2014006547.CaseDesc: Gregory Caesar was last seen near Watson Lake, Yukon Territory, in October, 2009. He was hitchhiking along the Alaska Highway and was believed to be heading to the Lower Mainland area of British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014001469.CaseDesc: On November 28,1988, Douglas Babineau was seen for the last time at a party located on First Avenue in Moncton, New Brunswick. Douglas has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002231.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1980, Heinz Gamper was seen for the last time when he went mountain climbing in Jasper National Park in Jasper, Alberta. Following this time, Heinz was scheduled to work, but he did not attend his scheduled shift.

Case reference: 2008019999.CaseDesc: Patrick O’Connell has been missing since July 4, 2008. He was last seen by a friend and roommate. Patrick suffers from schizophrenia, substance abuse issues, and has previously made comments that he may harm himself.

Case reference: 2022014037.CaseDesc: On March 23, 2022, Roger Vidito was seen for the last time as he left his residence in the west-end of Ottawa, Ontario. Roger grew up on the east coast of Canada, and there may be a possibility that he travelled there.

Case reference: 2012020117.CaseDesc: On November 24, 1995, Chantal Picotte was reported missing by her mother. Chantal was last seen on the evening of Wednesday, November 22, 1995 at a bar in Saint-Jérôme, Quebec.  She had called her mother that evening asking her to come see her. The next day, Chantal's mother went to her daughter’s residence, but Chantal was not there. The mother made several attempts to call her daughter without any success.

Case reference: 2006020199.CaseDesc: Christopher Nemmers was last seen on August 11, 1992 on the Sturgeon River. He was going to drain water from a boat and was heard calling for help, then seen slipping under the water. He is presumed drowned and his body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2014003903.CaseDesc: Anthony Kootenay walked away from the Algar Tower fire camp 73 kilometres south of Fort McMurray, Alberta on July 13, 1985 at approximately 3:00 am. In the previous days he was described by colleagues as suffering from mental health issues related to alcohol abuse. It is believed he may have attempted to hitch-hike from the area as a passing motorist spotted someone matching his description. An extensive search by land and helicopter was conducted, however Anthony was not located. Two unconfirmed sightings occurred at the Grand Hotel in Edmonton, AB on December 23, 1985 and January 16, 1986. There have been no sightings since that time.

Shoes: Blue, Running shoes with no laces
Tattoo: Left Hand, Tony on the 4 fingers
Left Arm, A flower with 4 petals

Case reference: 2014005826.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2012, the Banff RCMP were contacted by a tour company to report that Duc Dao and his son, Nguyen Dao of Vietnam did not arrive to board their bus at the scheduled time.  The two men had been staying at the Banff International Hotel and there were no personal items left in their room. The two men were due to fly back to Vietnam two days later. However, they did not board their scheduled flight and it is unknown if they returned to Vietnam.

Case reference: 2014005971.CaseDesc: Mrs. Guifeng Tong was last seen on video surveillance at her apartment on January 16, 2013 at 0958hrs. She was known to frequent Crystal Mall, Lougheed Mall and Metrotown Mall. She also likes to pick mushrooms at numerous parks in the lower mainland.

Case reference: 2014004009.CaseDesc: On April 7, 1987, Dale Eldridge was seen for the last time as he went down to a river with some of his friends in Peace River, Alberta. Prior to that, Dale had attended a party.

Shoes: White, North Star, North Star brand running shoes

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2014004296.CaseDesc: On November 20, 2002, Lowell Flett was reported missing by his employer as he had failed to show up for work for the 5th day. Lowell was last seen by his girlfriend, on November 16th. He left the residence on his ski-doo and has not been seen since. Despite intensive land and water searches neither Mr. Flett nor his ski-doo have been located. He is presumed to have drowned as a result of his sled falling through the ice.

Case reference: 2019070875.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2019, the remains of a woman were found in a crawl space of a triplex in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014001102.CaseDesc: On March 4, 1973, the remains of a young adult man were recovered from the Burrard Inlet in Vancouver, British Columbia. He carried a Canada flag pocket knife and is believed to have been in the water for several months prior to the discovery.

Case reference: 2016006093.CaseDesc: On January 19, 2016, Michelle Smits was seen for the last time as she travelled from Cambridge, Ontario to the United States. In February, Michelle’s vehicle was found abandoned in Boston, Massachusetts.

Case reference: 2014002017.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1997, Marc Dionne was seen for the last time as he was leaving the Harley Pub in the Cap-de-la-Madeleine area of Trois-Rivières, Quebec. He was a passenger in a small white vehicle. Marc was reported missing on the next day and there has been no news from him since.

Case reference: 2021037317.CaseDesc: On 18 August, 2021, Kari Campbell was seen for the last time in the Durham Bridge region of York County, New Brunswick. Kari has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2020007968.CaseDesc: On May 30, 1977, Aurelio Ferreira was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to his disappearance, Aurelio was despondent.

Case reference: 2010000499.CaseDesc: David Kruger was running a business with another individual, and was experiencing financial difficulties. On April 26, 1979, Mr. Kruger was last seen by his business partner, who reported him missing on May 2, 1979. He has not been seen or heard from since. Mr. Kruger's mother had died approximately 3 weeks prior, so it is possible he may have been depressed. He was last seen at his residence in Guelph, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020154.CaseDesc: This female was recovered from the Burrard Inlet, approximately 200 feet from the wharf at Versatile Pacific Shipyards.

Gloves: Synthetic, White, White dress gloves in pocket

Case reference: 2016046700.CaseDesc: Mr. LADD was last seen on August 18, 2016, by his daughter at his residence where he prepared them dinner.  Mr. LADD stated he needed to run out for a while and did not return.

Case reference: 2015011654.CaseDesc: On December 3, 1994, a baby was found in the Rivière des Prairies between the island of Montréal and the Visitation park Island in the Ahuntsic neighborhood. The body was naked and had a plastic bag wrapped around the wrist. According to experts the body would have been in the water since the fall.

Case reference: 2014001012.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2001, the skull of a man was discovered in a rural area near Mineral's Road in the town of Conception Bay South, Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2014004864.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2006, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Ahmed Moalin-Mohamed was seen for the last time as he left his apartment to search for employment in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006349.CaseDesc: Jonathan Riley left his residence on April 26, 2013, indicating he was going to Toronto for a few days. His mode of transportation is unknown as he did not have access to a vehicle.  His family and friends have not heard from him since May 2013.  He is a self-employed computer technician.

Case reference: 2015044121.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1972, Allen Robert Foy was seen for the last time leaving his home in the Saint-Hubert district of Longueuil, Quebec. Allen Robert said he was travelling on vacation north in the Laurentians to go fishing. He left in his vehicle, a green 1970’s Chrysler Newport which was found 4 or 5 years later, near the Dorval airport in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014002578.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1979, Martin Corbet was seen for the last time as he went hunting in the woods.

Hat: Wool, Yellow, Toque; Yellow, Black, Orange
